intro: Leichhardtia neocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonia leichhardtia, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
